sentences.en: A Book publisher may alter or abridge a work with the permission of the copyright owner.
sentences.cn: 图书出版者经版权拥有者许可,可以对作品修改或删节.

sentences.en: Article 33 A book publisher may alter or abridge a work with the permission of the copyright owner.
sentences.cn: 第三十三条图书出版者经作者许可，可以对作品修改、删节。

sentences.en: Article 33 Book publishers may modify or abridge works with the license of authors.
sentences.cn: 第三十三条图书出版者经作者许可,可以对作品修改、删节.

sentences.en: Book publisher may alter or abridge a work with the permission of the copyright owner.
sentences.cn: 图书出版者经作者许可,可以对作品修改、删节.

sentences.en: She decided to abridge her stay in campus since she wants to hunt for a job immediately.
sentences.cn: 考虑到她想要马上找工作，他决定缩短在校园里逗留的时间。

sentences.en: The time is limited, so he abridge his composition.
sentences.cn: 时间有限，他缩短了他的作文。

sentences.en: They are going to abridge that dictionary.
sentences.cn: 他们将要精简那本字典.

sentences.en: Thus he may abridge his travel , with much profit.
sentences.cn: 只要做到上述各点,他就能在短期游历中受益良多.

sentences.en: Tis less discredit to abridge petty charges, than to stoop to petty gettings.
sentences.cn: 节省一丝一毫金钱, 不会比为小小的收入而屈尊丢脸.

words.tran_cn: 删节；删节本；[图情] 文摘；缩短；限制
缩短；减少；删去（abridge的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 删节, 削减, 精简
trans.tran_en: to reduce the length of (a written work) by condensing or rewriting

trans.tran_cn: 节略，减少，缩短，<古>剥夺（某人的）权利（或特权等）
